An evening stopover is an advantageous solution for your business trips. Offering a good compromise between meals and accommodation, this formula is very practical to make your life easier during frequent trips. Book your evening stopover now for your next stay in Béziers.

What is an evening stopover ?

It is a turnkey accommodation formula offered by a hotel and which is exclusively intended for people who often travel for business. The concept of an evening stopover is to offer entrepreneurs, sales representatives and salespeople a package including overnight stay, dinner and breakfast.Its main advantage is that it allows you to find the basic services you need during your travels, in the same place. Another advantage is that hoteliers generally charge very competitive rates to match the maximum reimbursements set by companies for long-distance travel allowances.

Choosing the right hotel for your evening stopover in Béziers

Several criteria determine the choice of hotel for your trip to Béziers. Choose a hotel that is close to major roads, the airport or the train station, depending on your usual means of transportation. In addition to the basic Béziers stopover package, some Béziers hotels offer simplified check-in and check-out procedures, as well as an express breakfast in the morning, to make it easier for you to organize your free time. Wi-Fi and quality bedding are also available in the rooms. Those traveling by car can rest easy: you will find secure parking in these hotels. In short, a stopover is the ideal formula for a successful business trip. You will benefit from both quality services at a reasonable price and appreciable comfort.

translate-22.title: Everything to make your country wedding a success
translate-22.h1: 4 tips for a successful country wedding decoration
translate-22.contenu:
To make a success of your country wedding, you have to know that everything goes through the decoration, every detail has its importance. There are no real rules for a country wedding, you just need a little imagination, nice accessories and the possibilities are endless. Let's give you some tips that will be useful to succeed in your decoration of this special day.

1/ Choose simple and raw materials with a natural effect

Use wood to give charm and elegance to the reception room: pallets decorated with flowers or an easel with its tree of prints will be very successful. Slate is also a safe bet, put a few touches here and there, such as for place cards or to display the wedding menu. Straw and hay bales are decorative elements that recall the country side of the wedding, so you can decorate your table, your chairs and your reception area by placing them in the four corners of the room. Use burlap, lace and rope especially for the cutlery bags, the tablecloth in the center of the table, but also for the wedding ring cushions and the glass flower pots which will give a more vintage effect.

2/Choose the appropriate flowers

Who says country wedding says flowers, flowers have all their importance here since it is a main element of your decor. For this theme, we will choose flowers from the fields such as chamomile flowers or carnations. Garlands of leaves and small artificial flowers to decorate your table without breaking the bank at the florist are good solutions.

3/Find decorative elements that remind you of wildlife

Country weddings are often associated with nature and therefore with the little flying insects that live among the pretty flowers. So to make a little reminder and go to the end of things, small butterflies and ladybugs decorations will bring life and color to your table.

4/Create a warm atmosphere

Candles and candleholders, paper garlands and lanterns will bring charm and a cocooning effect to your decoration. Say goodbye to the small separate tables, make way for a large buffet style table, very friendly and warm where everyone will be able to eat a good country meal. To conclude, if you want to have a country wedding wait for spring, when flowers bloom the best, you will avoid the bad days and the strong heat. Play with elements of nature to give a more natural look to your decor but above all, enjoy yourself.

translate-23.title: Typical Japanese dishes
translate-23.h1: Top 4 typical Japanese dishes to try
translate-23.contenu:
Lovers of Japan should absolutely try my selection of incredibly good typical Japanese dishes.

Top #4: Okonomiyaki

It's a Japanese cabbage omelette, mixed with noodles, vegetables and a broth called "dashi". The whole thing is garnished with herbs and chives and a special sauce that resembles a Japanese mayonnaise. The concept is simple, the ingredients are placed on a hot plate on your table, and it's up to you to mix it all together and enjoy it with family or friends.

Top # 3: Onigiri

The onigiri is a small snack that the Japanese love, it is a Japanese sandwich a little special because there is no bread as for the Western sandwiches. It is a rice ball, shaped like a triangle, filled with various fillings, such as cooked tuna and mayonnaise, salmon, lemon shrimp, beef, tuna and samurai sauce and many others. The whole thing is wrapped in a sheet of seaweed called Nori and sprinkled with sesame seeds and onigiri spices. I recommend it for your little hunger in public transport.

Top #2: Katsu Kare

This is a white rice served with breaded pork and a Japanese curry sauce which is thicker and milder than the Indian curry. It is distinguished by its brown color unlike the Indian curry which is yellow. A pure hot and greedy delight not to be missed.

Top #1: Takoyaki

Takoyaki is the great specialty of Osaka city, it is small balls of dough filled with octopus, cheese, broth, chives, and seaweed. They are usually sprinkled with dried bonito (fish family), herbs and sauce. They are eaten hot and cooked in a waffle iron with a special mold. A convivial dish to be eaten like a raclette, a real treat.

translate-24.title: Lisa Gardner: "Perfect family" or almost
translate-24.contenu: The author takes us into the disconcerting daily life of a family that seems so perfect.The Denbes are often on the cover of magazines. They are portrayed as the perfect, successful family. The 15-year-old daughter is simply beautiful. The Denbes' Boston home is a palace. The couple is considered a model. In short, this is a family that is above suspicion. But appearances are deceiving. The dream life comes to an abrupt end when the Denbes disappear. Detective Tessa Leoni takes charge of the investigation. She is certain that it is a kidnapping, even though no ransom demands or motives have been determined. Her only clues are the taser cartridges scattered on the ground and, as a bonus, the footprints. Where will this investigation lead her? What is the other side of this idyllic setting? Readers have appreciated the classic plot, which is skilfully combined with omnipresent suspense and unexpected twists. Will you be able to solve this disappearance?

translate-25.title: I recommend "Sleeping Beauties" by Stephen King
translate-25.h1: I recommend "Sleeping Beauties" by Stephen King
translate-25.contenu: The Sleeping Beauty tale is completely revisited to seduce an adult audience passionate about endless machinations and suspense... Stephen King, the undisputed master of fiction, thrillers and fantasy works, is no longer to be found. It is with his son Owen that he co-wrote Sleeping Beauties, a novel that critics describe as a panegyric of femininity. The mystical and mysterious undertones that are King's signature are obviously very present, and father and son have imagined a world where all women who succumb to the call of sleep find themselves trapped in a mysterious cocoon. Waking them up is certainly not the best idea because it would transform these peaceful women into furies thirsting for revenge. The phenomenon of Aurora fever is growing and no woman seems to escape it. The world is now at the mercy of men and their violence. But in an Appalachian town, a woman named Evie seems to resist the fever....

translate-26.title: Let's go for a little ride
translate-26.h1: Let's go for a little ride
translate-26.contenu: Whether you want to have fun or discover with family or friends, a walk is an excellent idea. You can choose between hiking, biking or even horseback riding. Both are beneficial in that they allow you to live new experiences in the heart of nature. To get the most out of your family hike, careful preparation is required. You must define in advance the route to follow and provide yourself with the various equipment necessary for such an adventure. If between friends, the motivation of each participant is not necessary, it is not the case with children. Between the ages of 5 and 7, they will follow you without question, but it will be more difficult for them from 9 to 12 years old. For this category you must find the necessary arguments to motivate them. For example, you can let them take the initiative in preparing the hike or even allow them to invite a friend to this family outing. Explain to the children what you are going to do during this outing. There is no shortage of ideas at this level. You can tell them that you will spend a night in an unusual accommodation such as a refuge or that you will follow the tracks of a wolf. You can make your hike even more fun by equipping your toddlers' phones with applications that allow them to walk while having fun. All you have to do is find the hiking trails or bike paths in order to make the most of this activity with family or friends. Whether you choose to bike or hike, you'll be delighted to discover breathtaking landscapes.

translate-27.title: Advantages and disadvantages of living in Noumea
translate-27.contenu:
Seduced by the paradisiacal setting and the cosmopolitan character of New Caledonia, I moved to Noumea. I had an enriching experience on many sides, despite some disappointments. After living in the New Caledonian capital for 2 years, I decided to share with you my impressions of my stay in Nouméa. By the way, if you have already booked your plane tickets and your luggage is ready for the trip, go read my article on how to travel safely!

What I liked in Noumea

1. The beauty of the place

Noumea is the main city of the southern province of New Caledonia. It is located on Grande Terre, an island situated in the heart of a large lagoon bordered by a coral reef. Its superb landscapes reveal a fauna and flora still well preserved. The city preserves nearly 230ha of mangrove near the coastline which still has some mangrove trees several hundred years old. Its 120km of coastline is dotted with beautiful sandy beaches inviting you to relax, with the small islands of the New Caledonian archipelago in the background. A short boat ride will take you to Pine Island, one of the archipelago's unspoiled territories. During the egg-laying season, it is also possible to go to Turtle Bay, a few hundred kilometers from Noumea, to observe these majestic marine animals.

2. A less stressful life than in mainland France

The pace of life in Noumea is much more relaxed. Because of the warm tropical climate in the South Pacific, there is always an air of vacation. Here, people live mainly in the morning to adapt to the weather. Moreover, school starts earlier than in mainland France. Classes start around 8am and end around 3:30pm, with a short break between 11:15am and 1pm. In the late afternoon, it is not uncommon to see water sports enthusiasts at the beach. The atmosphere in Noumea is also more friendly. Natives and tourists mingle on the Place des Cocotiers. The locals are open. It is easy to make new friends. Caledonians are used to being on familiar terms.

3. A society full of diversity

Multiculturalism is omnipresent in Nouméa. The different influences can be seen in the city's architecture as well as in its cuisine. Upscale residential areas rub shoulders with the huts. Indeed, many Kanaks still live in traditional houses. In the center of Nouméa, one can still find buildings dating from the colonization period. The population of Nouméa has several origins. A large majority is European. They are metropolitans and Caldoches, expatriates who have lived on the island for several generations and descendants of former colonists. The Kanak population, the indigenous tribe, represents a significant part of the population. In addition, there are Asian and Oceanian communities. Many Melanesians come from other French overseas territories such as Wallis and Futuna or Tahiti. The cultural diversity of the city is also reflected in its leisure activities. During my stay, I had the opportunity to visit many museums and art galleries, and to go to the movies.

Living in Nouméa : what I didn't like

1. A delicate political situation

During my stay in Nouméa, I was able to realize the political tension that reigns in the archipelago. The tragic events of 1988, which took place at the Ouvéa cave, are still very present in people's minds. In the aftermath of colonization, the pro-independence movement opposed the loyalists on the issue of New Caledonia's independence. It claims the total autonomy of New Caledonia vis-à-vis the French Republic. In accordance with the provisions of the Nouméa Accord, the indigenous people put the situation to a vote. The two referendums held respectively in 1987 and 2018 had an identical outcome: the rejection of independence. The uncertain situation in Caledonia is leading to a feeling of insecurity in some regions.

2. A relatively expensive life

As far as currency is concerned, 1 euro is equivalent to about 120 Pacific francs. Overall, life is significantly more expensive in the New Caledonian capital compared to the rest of the island and to Metropolitan France. This is mainly due to the monopoly found in several sectors of activity. You will find many imported products in the shops. The high taxes applied increase the selling price considerably. The increase in the expatriate population in Nouméa has an impact on the real estate market. The supply of rental housing is insufficient to meet the growing demand. Rents are sometimes more expensive than in mainland France. Charges weigh quite heavily on the budget. Water and electricity bills, telephone and internet subscriptions, and living expenses add up quickly. The influx of tourists throughout the year affects the price of entertainment. On average, it costs 10€ for a movie ticket and the bill is quite high at restaurants.

3. Distance from my family and friends

As Nouméa has modern infrastructures, it is easy to forget that New Caledonia is almost 17,000km away from Metropolitan France. Inviting your relatives to visit you or to spend a few days in France was complicated during my stay in Noumea. If having a valid French passport is enough to travel between France and this overseas territory, the trip is particularly long. You have to plan at least 25 hours of flight time. The routes include one to three stopovers depending on the itinerary chosen. Flights usually stop in Japan or Australia before arriving at the destination. Moreover, the ticket is relatively expensive. It is recommended to prepare the trip at least 6 months in advance to find the best deals. It is also 9 hours longer in Noumea than in France. The time difference makes telephone or internet communication difficult. Calls must be well scheduled to fit everyone's availability. Moving to Noumea allowed me to change my pace of life while enjoying an idyllic setting marked by turquoise lagoons and beaches. Despite the high cost of living and the tension due to the instability of the political situation on the island, the city remains a great place to live.

translate-28.title: Important points for applying for an EV
translate-28.h1: What you need to know before applying for an AEO for Canada
translate-28.contenu:
Ottawa, Toronto, Montreal or Vancouver, many Canadian cities are increasingly popular with travelers. Indeed, with its breathtaking landscapes and enriching culture, Canada is one of the most attractive countries.However, some people, no doubt in a hurry to travel to this magnificent country, sometimes forget about the few (not very restrictive) steps to be taken beforehand. Indeed, the first essential reflex is to apply for an AVE! You will find in this article all the necessary information to prepare your trip to the "Great White North".

AVE application: what is it?

Different from the traditional visa, the AVE, meaning "electronic travel authorization", is a mandatory and indispensable document to enter the Canadian territory. Whether you are in transit in an airport or determined to explore this fabulous country for several months, you will naturally be asked by an immigration officer to present this document. Don't panic, in the overwhelming majority of cases, everything will go smoothly and you will be allowed to stay in the country. Valid for five years from the date of issue, the AVE Canada can be obtained very easily online. It is generally recommended to make this request on the official website of Canada, in order to benefit from a complete security, as well as clear and precise explanations. Indeed, it is even possible to find a PDF file on the website in order to guide you step by step through all the steps of the process. You will then have to fill out a form, as well as pay a processing fee of 7$ CAN (a little less than 5 €). A very small amount compared to some visa applications.In the vast majority of cases, applications are accepted within a few minutes, and the applicant immediately receives a confirmation e-mail with all the details. However, for various reasons, your application may take longer to process. In this case, you will most likely receive an e-mail asking you to provide additional documents. This may be a minor hiccup, but it will end favorably if the process is carried out in accordance with the established rules.

What is the deadline for applying?

One of the advantages of the official AVE Canada application is that it can be obtained at any time! Whether you have been planning your trip for several months or decide to leave on a whim, it is possible to obtain this document in just a few minutes. However, it is advisable to apply for it before buying your plane tickets, in order to avoid any unpleasant surprises. This is a logical clarification, but it is useful to remember it for people who tend to do things in the wrong order. In order to plan ahead, allow a week (maximum), in case additional documents are required, before you finally book your plane tickets.

Points not to neglect

Although theAVE Canada is easy to obtain, there are a few things to keep in mind, as with any administrative formality of this kind. First of all, you have to pay attention to the information you provide in the form (name, first name, passport number, etc.). Then, when you receive your confirmation e-mail, you must check that the information on the AVE is correct (no typing errors in the name, identical passport number, etc). Also, before applying for your AVE online, always make sure to check the validity date of your passport... Finally, don't forget your passport when you go to the airport, as well as a printed or "online" version of your AVE. Now you're ready, just pack your bags!

translate-29.title: The best men's underwear
translate-29.h1: Comfort and fashion for men: which underwear to choose?
translate-29.contenu:
Despite its great discretion, men's underwear is a real essential. It contributes greatly to comfort and plays an essential role in the look. The choice is therefore far from trivial, but how do you know which type suits you best? Don't panic, useful answers await you below.

The brief

Considered as old-fashioned by many men, briefs are nevertheless a safe bet. Although they are not particularly sexy, they offer excellent support thanks to their cut that perfectly fits the male morphology. A wide elasticated band usually acts as a belt, which accentuates the comfortable effect. A true classic in terms of men's underwear, briefs are recommended for day and night. New design techniques also make it possible to find seamless briefs that are discreet in close-fitting pants and have the added advantage of limiting chafing. Add to this the fact that the front pocket greatly improves support and comfort.

The boxer

The boxer is the most popular male underwear in France. And for good reason, it has a very close fit that molds the shapes to perfection without tightening. Its length which covers the top of the thighs is another asset: the rubbings are limited. The crotch has a reinforced shell on most models. Choosing a comfortable and suitable boxer is the best alternative, and this is combined with the tight fit for a perfect support of the male member. That's why boxer shorts are the underwear that sportsmen prefer. Indeed, the comfort remains optimal whatever the intensity of the efforts or the duration of the trainings/competitions. Of course, they can be worn on a daily basis to take advantage of their many benefits, including their discretion under tight-fitting clothes. [caption id="attachment_659" align="alignnone" width="1200"] Go for the boxer![/caption]

The boxer

The boxer is another classic underwear for men. It is easily recognizable by its loose shape that promises high comfort. Elasticated at the waist, it usually has an opening -buttoned or not-, practical to urinate without having to lower his underwear. Their loose fit, similar to shorts, makes them a good choice for evening and night wear, but also for casual wear. On the other hand, boxer shorts do not offer any support. They cannot be worn for sports sessions, even if they can be worn under jogging pants. The ideal underwear is therefore the one in which you will be comfortable according to your activities: a good support for your dynamic days -and evenings- and a looser model to be comfortable during your cosy moments.

translate-30.title: Disneyland Paris: the ideal destination for couples
translate-30.h1: Our tips for a romantic trip to Disney
translate-30.contenu:
Enchantment is not just for children. So, a romantic trip to Disneyland Paris is a perfect idea to rekindle the spark or turn it into a blaze of happiness. Not sure what to do when you get there? Check out our tips for an unforgettable romantic stay.

Get your room decorated

Nothing is impossible in this world of magic, and creating an ultra-romantic hotel room with the theme of your choice is right up the team's alley. Declare your love or propose to your sweetheart through a personalized decoration. You don't know how to create the surprise? It's simple: specify the theme that inspires you at the time of your reservation. You will be put in touch with the decoration team and there you will be able to choose the elements that you like the most: sweets, gifts, stuffed animals with the effigy of Disney characters... everything is allowed! The decoration can be prepared before your arrival but you also have the possibility of choosing another timing - a day or a special evening for example - during your stay for two.

Lunch at a Disney-themed restaurant

A couple's trip goes hand in hand with gourmet tête-à-têtes. It's easy to find a restaurant in this magical Disney world, just a stone's throw from Marne la Vallée. At the bistro Chez Rémy, everything is oversized, giving you the impression of being shriveled up and thus living a unique experience in the skin of the charming rat chef. French specialties are served with a touch of fantasy. Spice up your gourmet rendez-vous with a Caribbean touch by reserving your table at the Blue Lagoon. It's as if you were on a beach, immersed in the Pirates of the Caribbean décor. You like refinement and fairy tales? L'Auberge de Cendrillon is the perfect restaurant for your stay!

Enjoy the magic of Disney, attend the parade and the illuminations of the castle

Take advantage of your visit to Disney Village to board the PanoraMagique. It's a tethered balloon that offers a magnificent view of Disney Studios and its surroundings. Sleeping Beauty's castle, whose stained glass windows change like magic, is another must-see place to attend shows rich in special effects. Experience an intense stay with your soul mate by opting for unique activities in a magical atmosphere. From parades to themed restaurants, there is no shortage of choices!

translate-31.title: Steps to organize the funeral of a deceased person
translate-31.h1: How to organize the funeral of a loved one?
translate-31.contenu:
Death can happen to anyone at any time. So when someone loses a loved one, they are in a momentary state of pain and distress. No one is really prepared for the funeral of a loved one.However, it is necessary to pay a last tribute to the loved one and to mourn. If the deceased did not prepare his death during his lifetime, the family must make arrangements for a ceremony corresponding to his last wishes. This article will guide you through the steps to take.

Taking care of the different files to legalize the situation

Before proceeding with the organization of the funeral, it is necessary to take care of the necessary formalities to be able to recover the body of the deceased. To do this, it is necessary to establish a medical certificate of death which will be used to declare the death to the town hall. The latter will establish a death certificate. This procedure can be undertaken by a family member, but it is usually done by funeral companies.

Contacting a funeral company

To ease your situation in this time of sorrow, it is advisable to contact a funeral company. You can compare several of them to get a free estimate before choosing the one that best suits you. The interview with the funeral home will allow you to give the necessary information to pay a last tribute to the deceased. Respecting the last wishes of the deceased and his family, the company will be able to prepare flowers, decorative objects or make a personalized funeral plaque that can be found on the website https://plaquedeces.fr.

Organizing the ceremony

Before the body of the deceased is disposed of, a ceremony is often organized. This ceremony can be religious or not, depending on the religious or cultural beliefs of the deceased and his family.

Opting for a civil or secular ceremony

To cope with the passing of a loved one, the family can organize the ceremony of the deceased by personalizing a last tribute and fulfilling certain ritual needs. This civil ceremony can take place just before the burial, at the crematorium or in a ceremony room specially dedicated to it. Usually, a guest book is made available and filled in by those present to collect some testimonies or memories in memory of the deceased. During this civil ceremony, it is also customary to read texts, poems or make a speech to honor the memory of the deceased. Other ceremonies include a film, music, or photos to commemorate the deceased.

Opting for a religious ceremony

If the deceased was known to be a religious person, it is normal to hold a ceremony that respects the traditions of the religion he or she practiced. Remember to contact the religious authorities of which the deceased was a member. Some of them give you the opportunity to choose songs, prayers and certain music. In this case, the ceremony can take place in the place of worship or in the cemetery.

Choosing the burial method

If the deceased did not make any last wishes concerning his or her body during his or her lifetime, it is up to a family member to choose between burial or cremation.

Burial

Burial is a very common funeral custom around the world. It consists of placing the body of the deceased in the ground and is more commonly called burial. In France, a person who dies has the right to be buried in certain cemeteries. Those of the municipality where the death was noted, the place where he or she lived or the one where he or she has a family burial. In all cases, the city hall must issue a burial permit to proceed with the burial.

Cremation

This process is to be considered for various reasons, notably financial or ecological. It is important to know that cremation is becoming more and more common among the French population. In order to perform a cremation, you must first have a cremation authorization from the mayor of the commune where the burial is necessary. Then, after cremation, the urn containing the ashes can be placed in a cemetery or columbarium. They can also be scattered in the open air or on private property.Good to know: it is useful to discuss the desired funeral and put your wishes in writing during your lifetime. This will avoid complications and disputes between family members.

Financing the funeral

Funerals must be paid for by the family of the deceased. To alleviate these expenses, you can resort to a few entities. In particular, you have the social security, the mutual insurance company of the deceased and his insurance company (life or death) if he has subscribed. In addition, it is possible to deduct from the savings or account of the deceased. If the deceased or his family cannot pay for the funeral, the municipality should take care of it.Note: making several copies of the death certificate is very useful. Also, be sure to keep the funeral bill.

translate-32.title: vide
translate-32.contenu:
You are getting married and you want to organize a buffet for the meal ? Have you considered a cold buffet? This type of buffet has many advantages, and can be synonymous with something sophisticated nowadays, whereas in the past it was not. Here are some ideas for a successful cold buffet for a wedding.

Why choose a cold buffet for your wedding?

It all depends on the style of your wedding, but a cold buffet is an option in most circumstances. It is a choice that can be more original than the classic hot dishes , and it is usually less expensive than a hot buffet (and definitely more economical than a sit-down meal). For the logistical part, the fact that you don't have to keep dishes warm simplifies the organization. Finally, if you are getting married in a warm period (or in a place where the weather is nice all year long!), your guests will greatly appreciate a cold meal. It is a type of buffet that is also very popular with children and teenagers, and the cold buffet goes very well with a country wedding decoration! Why not combine the two?

Cold buffet wedding ideas: get help from your caterer

A wedding meal is a very important moment that you only organize once in your life. It is therefore essential to be guided by a specialist, a professional in the field who will know which dishes will suit your wedding, according to its theme, the number of guests, the circumstances of the meal, and the age of the people attending the party. If you are looking for a wedding caterer in the 06, we recommend termer-traiteur, as you should always have something to please the little ones... without neglecting the wishes of the older ones! A caterer, a qualified professional, has the necessary skills to manage the organization of your cold buffet from A to Z.

5 trendy wedding cold buffet ideas

The cold buffet is very trendy for weddings nowadays, and here are some ideas of dishes that are in fashion at the moment as part of such a buffet. This is a non-exhaustive list, but it will give you a nice base for your buffet!

Culinary workshops for the wine of honor

The wine of honor, we organize it sweet or salty according to its schedule, chouquettes or petit-fours, even a mixture of both, but we rarely leave the classics. To shake up your guests' habits, think of culinary workshops! Your caterer and his employees will be able to initiate your guests to some gastronomic secrets during this appetizer. Originality and success with your guests are guaranteed!

Verrines for the starter

The trend of verrines is confirmed and can be declined almost endlessly: sweet, savory, with meat, fish, vegetarian, with cheese, with fruits... Almost any combination is possible. Talk to your caterer to find the perfect ones for your wedding day; you can of course choose different ones to offer a wide choice to your guests... or simply if you can't decide!

Sharing platters for the dish

You may not be familiar with this trend which, as the anglicism that forms its name indicates, comes from the USA. Sharing platters are trays placed in the center of the table during the main course, from which your guests can pick as they wish. It's original, it avoids a long table service, and it pleases everyone, because it brings more variety than a single dish! All advantages for this innovative custom and at the top of the current trends in terms of cold buffet.

Dessert buffet

We sometimes opt for a single dessert at a wedding, for example a pièce montée, but a dessert buffet has many advantages! Each guest will be sure to find what he or she is looking for, and above all, an unfortunate fall will not spoil the end of your wedding meal! A dessert buffet can be monochrome or multicolored according to your tastes. In any case, it will be sure to amaze your guests, young and old alike!

Farandole of macaroons

To conclude with coffee, tea, and digestives, think of the farandole of macaroons! Colorful, with multiple tastes but always delicious, macaroons are THE ideal way to conclude a wedding meal, on a sweet and delicate note, for those who still have a little room in their stomachs! And the farandole, displayed on a table, can represent a motif, and will look great on the photos... but hurry up and take them, guests never resist the call of the macaroons for long! In conclusion, organizing a cold buffet for a wedding, a more practical, more economical solution, but just as greedy, is an excellent idea! Do not hesitate to contact a caterer specialized in this field, he will be able to guide you in your choices to make your wedding the most successful day of your life!

translate-33.title: vide
translate-33.h1: Find the jewel that suits you best!
translate-33.contenu:
You wish to please by buying a jewel, but you doubt in front of the numerous choices which are presented to the jeweler? Here is a small guide that will give you an overview of the possibilities you have, as well as some advice on how not to make a mistake.

Many criteria to choose from!

Among the main categories of jewelry, we find the ring, the bracelet, the earrings and the necklace. This is one of the first choices to make. Then, the material also has its importance, whether it is silver, gold, steel or other fancy, your jewelry must be adapted to the person who will wear it, for a better visual but also according to the type of skin and its age. For a child, especially babies, it is better to offer gold jewelry because other metals may not be suitable for a more fragile skin. But don't worry, the jewelry store will offer a selection of jewelry adapted to your needs. The occasion for which the jewelry will be used already gives a good indication. Wedding rings are obvious, as are bracelets and chains for a christening. Rings are often used to mark a milestone in a relationship, earrings or a pendant can complete your look at a party. You will then have to choose among all the different shapes, sizes and colors to finally find those fashion accessories that can make the difference.

The ring: a timeless classic

Since the time of the pharaohs, the ring is a jewel that is widely used and the custom of offering it during an engagement dates back to Roman antiquity. Nowadays, the most classic are those with a diamond, but there are rings for all tastes, all fingers and even all phalanges. For example, the fancy silver zigzag ring can be worn on the fingertip or on the thumb. For those who prefer stacked rings, a marquise like the Navina oval rose quartz and silver ring is a great option. Also very popular with men, the ring is a good way to stand out or to mark one's membership in a clan or brotherhood for example. More than a simple piece of jewelry, it can also be an anti-stress ring like the Dharma anti-stress ring in solid silver whose central rotating ring will give you style and relaxation. For children, there are also a variety of choices, although more discreet toe rings are more common.

The bracelet: aesthetic and whimsical

[caption id="attachment_844" align="alignnone" width="600"] Among popular jewelry, bracelets are very aesthetic[/caption] Used since prehistoric times for protection or religious rituals, the bracelet is now one of the must-have fashion accessories. The classic bracelet is made of chain links surrounding the wrist with sometimes medallions or other accessories attached to the links. One variation is the bracelet which is generally flatter with a plate where the first name or initials are engraved. Another type of bracelet is the shamballa, originally made of wooden beads in the Tibetan Buddhist culture, we now find some with crystal beads, diamond beads, or agate balls like this shamballa bracelet in black agate balls. According to tradition, the color of the beads has a meaning like relaxation for the blue, harmony for the green or prestige for the black. Another essential and very elegant, the ring is a rigid ring open or closed that allows to have class while keeping its simplicity. Finally, the cuff is wider, generally rigid and open for a more marked style. Appeared in the 30s, it still keeps its success to captivate the eyes during an evening. The bracelet Liliana openwork wide cuff sandblasted is the perfect example.

The necklace: elegant and surprising

The origin of necklaces also goes back to prehistory, allowing to expose to the world the wealth of the one who wears it. Golden, silver, flowers, choker, necklace or pendant, there is something for everyone. It can also be a fetish accessory or a lucky charm as for surfers for whom the necklace connects them with the sea. On the other hand, the pearl or rhinestone necklaces are a great classic that will give you a great elegance. This is the case of the Mala Tibetan mango wood bead necklace with small wooden beads for a more spiritual style while remaining very fashionable. A discreet choker necklace can also make a difference while allowing you to wear your medallion or amulet on you. On the other hand, the necklace is also a very effective accessory to attract the eye, ideal when you have shapes to highlight.

The earrings: seductive and unmissable

More than for aesthetics, earrings can be considered as a protective talisman or a sign of belonging. It was even said that it could improve the sight and chase away the moods. Today many hesitate between white gold or rose gold ear rings! Of course, they are now a must-have that will dress your ears in a seductive way. It is the case of the Indian Shaïna filigree silver earrings which will bring out your beauty while light and fine. Pearls or rhinestones are also used for a guaranteed elegance or crystal like these earrings "Mimi Lola" silver butterfly and Swarovski crystal for children. Another true fashion accessory, the creoles are ideal to attract the eyes, whether they are small, large, with a golden or silver effect, your face will appear more elongated with finer features. More than a fashion accessory, the jewel reflects your personality and will accompany you in everyday life or during special events. It will allow you to feel comfortable while showing charm and elegance.

translate-34.title: vide
translate-34.h1: Discover the equipment I use for karting!
translate-34.contenu:
Mechanical sports have always fascinated me and as I grew up I took up karting. Every moment on a karting track is a source of a pleasant adrenaline rush, but I am aware that there are certain risks. That's why I choose my protections very carefully.

For my safety, I always have a kart helmet

[caption id="attachment_850" align="aligncenter" width="1200"] The typical equipment for karting is necessary![/caption] Karting is driving an open vehicle. In other words, I am exposed to possible projectiles, but also to shocks. Helmets were invented to protect motorsport enthusiasts like me. I always wear a full-face helmet that I bought from grandprixracewear.com. To choose your helmet, I advise you to check the basic criteria such as the size of the helmet, the material it is made of and the size and color of the visor. It is extremely important that you feel comfortable and that you have a very good visibility on the karting track. The helmets are available in different designs. So you can match it with your other protections.

To be more preventive, I bought a karting protection

You're probably thinking of the driver's suit and gloves but I'm not there yet. It's more about the accessories that reinforce my protection. In particular, I usually wear a neck and rib protector, which I complement with knee and elbow pads. When I plan to go karting on a hot day, I also put on a cooling vest, always with the aim of staying perfectly comfortable. With such protection, I can enjoy the thrill with peace of mind.

I have a karting suit that combines protection and style!

Karting suits are essential for karting as they are specifically designed to protect the driver in case of a crash. The material used is perfectly resistant to abrasion. The cut can be ergonomic to optimize freedom of movement. I chose a light and breathable driver suit for leisure. In racing competition, I prefer thicker racing suits but they are still very comfortable to wear. As for the design, it depends on my inspiration of the moment, except in competition: I always wear a suit with the colors of my sponsors. I always opt for a homologous model.

I never forget my karting boots to protect my feet

Driving karts requires good sensitivity in the feet. Otherwise, you can't handle the pressure on the pedals effectively. Karting boots are specially made with this requirement in mind. The grip is excellent and I can feel my pedals very well, which allows me to adjust my speed in turns, but not only that. The high cut is an asset: in addition to the feet, the ankles are well protected. The quality of support is also appreciable.

My karting gloves offer me comfort and grip

You will agree that it is not easy to drive with sweaty or wet hands because of the weather. So racing gloves are a welcome addition to my kit as they give me a very good grip. The gloves also protect me from excess heat, cold and rain, but that's not to mention the most important thing: my hands are safe in case of a fall or an impact because they are not directly exposed. As a good motorsport enthusiast, I only trust the best brands, available at low prices in specialized stores.

To ensure the proper functioning of the kart, I have a kart lubricant.

Go-karts are like cars: they need to be pampered to function properly. They are not very demanding, but the use of a lubricant from time to time is highly recommended to keep the engine in perfect condition. The mechanical parts are protected against premature wear and all the gears work perfectly. I stay calm on the straight lines as well as in the turns, in leisure as well as in competition.

I also have a lot of kart accessories that come in handy!

I like the thrill but I don't like to be caught off guard and above all, it is essential for me to drive safely. That's why I invested in a digital pressure gauge that measures the pressure of my wheels and records my lap time, I also bought a cover so that my kart doesn't remain unnecessarily exposed to the elements and I have a very practical tire bag to make sure I'm operational. You don't have to buy the same accessories as I did, because the most important thing is to equip yourself according to your real needs. Karting safely is easy. The most important thing is to take care of the quality of your protective equipment and to make sure that you have a perfectly functional kart. You'll have a great time!
